definition: Lee Kuan Yew (1923-2015), founding father of modern Singapore, prime minister 1959-1990
plum
surname Li
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
brilliant/glorious

sentences.english: Li Guangyao’s mother also invests her hopes in the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 李光耀的妈妈也在她的下一代上投资着她自己的梦想。

sentences.english: Lee Kuan Yew still likes to jerk the strings backstage in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡的李光耀依然喜欢在幕后操纵大局。

sentences.english: Lee Kuan -yew contemplates retiring with a hand on the helm .
sentences.chinese: 李光耀打算退位而依然听政。

sentences.english: Li Guangyao's mother also invests her hopes in the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 李光耀的妈妈也在她的下一代上投资着她自己的梦想。
直至2011年，李光耀辞去“内阁资政”一职。

sentences.english: Kuan Yew is something of an oddity.
sentences.chinese: 李光耀的出现是个异数。

definition: Lee Hsien Loong (1952-), Singapore PAP politician, eldest son of Lee Kuan Yew 李光耀[Li3 Guang1 yao4], prime minister from 2004

People's Action Party (ruling party in Singapore)

(King) Sihanouk (of Cambodia)
father or founder of a nation/Father of the Republic (Sun Yat-sen)
former prime minister

Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Aung San Suu Kyi (1945-), Myanmar opposition leader and 1991 Nobel Peace laureate/also written 昂山素姬
